title: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site: Finding Aids
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections     Finding Aids                Finding Aids        Finding aids contain information on the contents and significance of an archival collection. The finding aid may include descriptive information; repository information; collection history; biographical or historical information on creators of the collection; and in some cases a container or folder list of everything in the collection. All collections are available for research upon request. For more information email us.  These finding aids represent only part of the collections housed in the park archive. Selected finding aids will be added as collections are processed. Mark Wilderman Collection, 1978-1982 (MIMI 2363) Mark Wilderman served 17 years in the United States Air Force. While at Ellsworth, Wilderman was able to work in almost all of the Launch Control Centers in the missile wing as well as complete his Masters in Political Science in March 1981. The collection includes photographs (positives and negatives) taken at Ellsworth AFB and at Charlie-01, Delta-01, and Hotel-01 and personal papers including personnel paperwork and class notes. Records of Golden West Telephone Company, Wall, South Dakota, 1961-1988 (MIMI 2459) Maps, contracts, correspondence, and other papers, relating to the construction of the Hardened Intersite Cabling System for the sites in the 66th Missile Squadron around Wall, South Dakota. Information included on earlier Titan site, part of the 850th Missile Squadron, located at Wicksville, South Dakota. Robert Meyers Personal Papers, 1963-1972 (MIMI 2503) Robert Meyer was born December 20, 1940. He served in the U. S. Air Force and Air National Guard from 1963 - 1972. The collection includes maps, technical orders, correspondence, and other papers, relating to the professional life of donor. Records of the 44th Strategic Missile Wing, Ellsworth Air Force Base, United States Air Force, 1959-2007 (MIMI 2864) Maps, technical orders, equipment manuals, contracts, correspondence, still pictures, videos, and other papers, relating to the construction, maintenance, and dismantling of Minuteman Missile sites operated by Ellsworth AFB as the 44th Missile Wing. Collection was created and maintained by the United States Air Force to document the construction and maintenance of the 44th Strategic Missile Wing based out of Ellsworth Air Force Base, South Dakota. This collection was maintained by the United States Air Force, eventually the 28th Civil Engineering Squadron at Ellsworth Air Force Base until its transfer in December 2007.
